Earlier this week, Superintendent Garcia sent a letter via email to AOT parents regarding the start of the 2020-2021 school year. Our schools will be starting school via distance learning on Thursday, August 6, which aligns with our district calendar. While we recognize that this is not ideal, it is the best option for the health and safety of our students and teachers.

According to the governor's June 29 executive order, schools may reopen for in-person learning on August 17; however, this date is not guaranteed. Our leaders will continue to monitor the situation to ensure the health and safety of our stakeholders is upheld.

Administrators and teachers will be in contact with parents, regarding what their virtual classrooms will look like, so if you have questions, please reach out. If you are not receiving emails from your school, please contact your school's office to be put on the email list.

Pandemic or no pandemic, this is a busy time of year! There's so much happening at each school to close out the year, so please heed any information you are receiving from teachers or principals before tomorrow. Here's a roundup of the happenings at each campus:

Elementary School: Come by for our final Smile By tomorrow, May 21 from 8-9 AM! As for returning school materials, please see the schedule sent out by Mr. Hancock. Also, Chromebooks should be returned by the end of day tomorrow.

Middle School: Tomorrow is the last locker cleanout, as well as textbook and Chromebook return. Please follow the schedule sent out by Mrs. Goodson this week.

High School: Locker clean out, sport jersey return and Chromebook return happening May 21 from 8-11 AM. We will be practicing social distancing and will restrict the number of students in the school at a time. Please bring a backpack or other bag to carry your locker belongings.

Of course, we're looking forward to seeing students and parents, but please be patient and adhere to schedules to ensure everyone's safety!
